subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group Membership**
author: bruce halliday

Misty,
 
Your wish is my command. I will convert to mp3
from now on.
 
bru=
ce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: bulletbabea@...=
Date: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 17:13:53 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notic=
e Regaurding Your Group Membership**




Yep I agree with a few files there=
 is some loss in conversion. Thats why I sent out that program because it h=
as next to no loss in the conversion. But again I will say I would rather p=
ost 1 meg of files than take up the entire groups space by posting 15 megs =
of files. When I want to share more complete audio I just use my esnips.com=
 account to do that. It is just as easy for people to click on my esnips ho=
tlink in a notification post as it is to click on the files link to the lef=
t.You are right we just have to manage ourselves better.Misty--- In EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > I=
 post in wav. format I believe when you convert the file from wav to mp3.> =
certain aspects of the file are lost. If an mp3. file is a tenth of the siz=
e of> a wav. file where does the other 9/10's go.> > If it is compressed th=
en it definitely loses quality. > I think every nuance in a box file is cru=
cial for the > correct interpretation of the file, sometimes the a word cre=
ated by the entity is not only> comprised of radio fragment but also static=
 noise mixed with the fragments of radio vocal> to form the message the ent=
ity wishes to leave. I don't know the technical aspects of the file > chang=
e but I think it's common sense that when you try to pour a gallon of water=
 into a shot glass> all you wind up with is a shot glass full of water the =
rest is spilled and lost.> > I keep my files posted for 5 or less days, jus=
t long enough for anyone that wants to listen can.> If your going to leave =
your files posted indefinitely and keep adding to the folder then of course=
 it will> put pressure on the storage space.> > As far as posting a notice =
for every file, some of us may wish to listen from their e-mail or not > ha=
ve to go to the file section to listen, That's probably why that option is =
given.> If I didn't like the notices cluttering up my e-mail in box you can=
 change that feature in the group> membership options. So if anyone does no=
t want that feature they can turn it off and only read posts on the group.>=
 > It's not the lack of space is the mismanagement of it by all of us. > wh=
en I change my files from wav. to mp3 I hear a distinct difference, do it i=
n an audio editor and you can visually see the difference.> > Bruce> Bruce =
Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: warrior18eii@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 05:05:37=
 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group Mem=
bership**> > > > > > > That's a great idea Steve and it was mentioned befor=
e but either no one noticed Misty's post or it was ignored. It would be a s=
hame though if people start loosing files because they are not paying atten=
tion to the owners instructions.Regards,Frank R.> ----- Original Message --=
--From: Steve Hultay <urkel23@...>To: EVP-ITC@...: Wednesday, January 30, 2=
008 6:06:23 AMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group=
 Membership**> > Misty,I have and idea. One solution is to post Mp3 files i=
nstead of Wav. files or any other format. It seems like the Mp3's sound the=
 same and are only 1/10th of the size. I think that would probably clear up=
 90 percent of the board right there. If i actually have more than a couple=
 files from here on out, i will be attaching them to an e-mail and not the =
board to save space here. And also, if people do post files maybe we can al=
l just have one post that says we have uploaded files to our folder instead=
 of 30 audio announcements in a row that just seems to waste a lot of e-mai=
l space in the individual e-mails. And it also pushes the current topic on =
the board to another page and is lost for those who wanted to share. Just m=
y thoughts on helping the subject. I know we are all excited, but misty is =
right. I went to add a file the other day and the group was at 93 percent c=
apacity, so it won't be long before we run out of space.-Steve H.--- In EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Misty" <bulletbabea@ ...> wrote:>> Just a little fr=
iendly reminder that you all need to organize your > files better in the fi=
les area. Space is limited here and you are all > nearing the 100% mark so =
try to keep your section under 5 megs. If > you need more space use www.esn=
ips.com and you can store 50 gigs to > share with the group or public.> > I=
 think it is great you guys have so much to share I just wish that > our ya=
hoo group wasnt so limited on space (and that I wasnt so > limited on time)=
. But I have found a way around it. If just a few > people signed up and sh=
ared using esnips they can invite others to > visit thier files and once th=
ey do they also get 50 gigs of free > space for audio pictures or video or =
whatever you want to post.> > I was considering setting up one "group" acco=
unt to start with and > inviting all members who post files to join it and =
be able to post to > the account. It will automatically notify everyone tha=
ts a member > when a file is added to it just like the yahoo group does. It=
 also > allows you to share with the public or privately if you so choose. =
> You can even allow your friends to post to your account if you wish.> > T=
his group has grown and expanded and we just need to make a few > changes t=
o how we do things to keep it running more smoothly for the > future. I am =
hoping that you all will help me in this endeavor. I > know many of you hav=
e already adapted the idea to help us organize > and maintain the group.> >=
 I want you to keep sharing and to be able to share more! > > So please org=
anize and not post stray files that are targets for > deletion once the que=
 is 100% full. And for your own sake, if no one > elses, be respectful to e=
ach other.> > MD>> > Be a better friend, newshound, and know-it-all with Ya=
hoo! Mobile. Try it now. > > > > > > > > __________________________________=
________________________> Helping your favorite cause is as easy as instant=
 messaging. You IM, we give.> http://im.live.com/Messenger/IM/Home/?source=
=3Dtext_hotmail_join>
